verses.text: The Levitical priests, all the tribe of Levi, shall have no portion or inheritance with Israel. They shall eat the LORD's offerings by fire, his inheritance.
verses.comment: Following the Hebrew word order and meaning; 'the LORD’s offerings by fire' rendered as sacrifices.

verses.text: They shall have no inheritance among their brothers; the LORD is their inheritance, as he promised them.
verses.comment: Consistent with Deuteronomy’s consistent point about the Levites’ inheritance.

verses.text: And this shall be the priest’s share from the people, from those who offer a sacrifice, whether it is an ox or a sheep: they shall give to the priest the shoulder, the two cheeks, and the stomach.
verses.comment: The Hebrew 'the two cheeks' is literal (jaw portions); ‘stomach’ for the Hebrew qeba‘.

verses.text: You shall give him the firstfruits of your grain, your new wine, your oil, and the first shearing of your sheep.
verses.comment: Hebrew for 'firstfruits' retained; 'new wine' for Hebrew tirosh.

verses.text: For the LORD your God has chosen him out of all your tribes to stand and minister in the name of the LORD, him and his sons for all time.
verses.comment: ‘Minister in the name of the LORD’ follows the Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: And if a Levite comes from any of your towns out of all Israel, where he lives, and comes whenever he desires to the place that the LORD will choose,
verses.comment: ‘The place that the LORD will choose’ used as in Deuteronomy.

verses.text: then he may minister in the name of the LORD his God, like all his fellow Levites who stand there before the LORD.
verses.comment: ‘Minister in the name of the LORD’ as in previous verses.

verses.text: They shall have equal portions to eat, besides what comes from the sale of his family possessions.
verses.comment: ‘Equal portions’ translates the Hebrew; second clause is literal.

verses.text: When you come into the land that the LORD your God is giving you, you shall not learn to do the abominations of those nations.
verses.comment: 'Abominations' translates Hebrew toʿevah.

verses.text: There shall not be found among you anyone who makes his son or his daughter pass through the fire, anyone who uses divination, tells fortunes, interprets omens, or practices sorcery,
verses.comment: 'Pass through the fire' refers to child sacrifice or dedication; the list of practices follows Hebrew closely.

verses.text: or who casts spells, or who is a medium, or a spiritist, or one who consults the dead.
verses.comment: Consistent with Hebrew terms for occult practices.

verses.text: For whoever does these things is an abomination to the LORD, and because of these abominations the LORD your God is driving them out before you.
verses.comment: ‘An abomination’ is the literal reading.

verses.text: You shall be blameless before the LORD your God.
verses.comment: 'Blameless' translates Hebrew tamim, meaning whole, upright.

verses.text: For these nations which you will dispossess listen to those who practice witchcraft and to diviners, but as for you, the LORD your God has not allowed you to do so.
verses.comment: 'Practice witchcraft and to diviners' is literal.

verses.text: The LORD your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among you, from your brothers. You shall listen to him.
verses.comment: 'A prophet like me' (i.e., like Moses) rendered literally.

verses.text: This is according to all that you asked of the LORD your God at Horeb on the day of the assembly, saying, 'Let me not hear again the voice of the LORD my God or see this great fire any more, lest I die.'
verses.comment: 'Horeb' is the alternate name for Sinai.

verses.text: And the LORD said to me, 'They have spoken well in what they have said.'
verses.comment: Literal rendering.

verses.text: I will raise up for them a prophet like you from among their brothers. I will put my words in his mouth, and he shall speak to them all that I command him.
verses.comment: Literal translation; ‘brothers’ is retained from the Hebrew achim.

verses.text: And whoever will not listen to my words that he will speak in my name, I myself will require it of him.
verses.comment: ‘Require it of him’ is a Hebrew idiom for holding accountable.

verses.text: But the prophet who presumes to speak a word in my name that I have not commanded him to speak, or who speaks in the name of other gods, that prophet shall die.
verses.comment: Literal rendering of the Hebrew phrases.

verses.text: And if you say in your heart, 'How can we know the word that the LORD has not spoken?'
verses.comment: Literal translation.

verses.text: When a prophet speaks in the name of the LORD, if the thing does not happen or come to pass, that is the thing that the LORD has not spoken; the prophet has spoken it presumptuously. You shall not be afraid of him.
verses.comment: 'Spoken it presumptuously' and 'do not be afraid' are literal renderings.
